title: Welcome To My Blog!
text: Hello, world! I wrote this blog to make notes of all insights that I discovered on my data science journey. I love wrangling and exploring data.

title: Southern California Weather Analysis (2010 - 2020)
text:
Exploratory Data Analysis

Show the code
# conditions 
total_cnd = sb_cnd['Year']
explode = [0.2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]

conditions = sb_cnd.index

# Seaborn color palette to plot pie chart
colors = sns.color_palette('pastel')

# create pie chart using matplotlib
font1 = {'family':'serif','color':'black','size':20}
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 8))
plt.title("San Bernardino", loc='left',fontdict = font1)
plt.pie(total_cnd, labels=conditions, colors=colors,
        autopct='%.0f%%',explode=explode, shadow=True, rotatelabels='true')
plt.savefig("sb_pie.jpg") #save as jpg
plt.show()







4.1.1.5. Description
Weather variables relatively constant on yearly basis. On monthly basis all variables also remain constant except Wind Direction. Wind Direction increased time to time, start from January and reached the highest score at 238.813226 in July. Average Conditions in San Bernardino are Clear and partially cloudy with 12% of rain.

4.1.9.5. Description
Weather variables relatively constant on yearly basis. On monthly basis all variables also remain constant except Wind Direction. Wind Direction increased time to time, start from January and reached the highest score at 242.467595 in July. Average Conditions in Riverside County are Clear Partially Cloudy with 12% of rain.

from mitosheet import *; register_analysis("id-ynheayqgsj");
    
# Pivoted into df
tmp_df = df[['YEAR_', 'CAUSE']]
pivot_table = tmp_df.pivot_table(
    index=['YEAR_'],
    columns=['CAUSE'],
    values=['CAUSE'],
    aggfunc={'CAUSE': ['count']}
)
pivot_table.set_axis([flatten_column_header(col) for col in pivot_table.keys()], axis=1, inplace=True)
df_pivot = pivot_table.reset_index()

# sum df_pivot
cause = df_pivot.sum()

# create new frame
cause_df = cause.to_frame()
cause_df.reset_index(inplace=True)

# column names
cause_df.columns = ['CAUSE', 'COUNT']

# drop label '0'
cause_df = cause_df.drop(labels=0, axis=0)

# change format
cause_df['COUNT'] = cause_df['COUNT'].astype(int)

# sorting
cause_df = cause_df.sort_values(by=['COUNT'],ascending = False)

# extract string
cause_df['CAUSE'] = cause_df.CAUSE.str.extract('(\d+)')
cause_df
